column1: full on middle stump, right on the money. Defended off the front foot to the non-striker
full outside off stump, prods forward and drives well. But straight to cover point
full just outside off stump. Jags inwards, and driven to mid on this time. Starts off with three dots
straight down the ground Starts off with a boundary, Duminy. Full on off stump, and he's through his straight drive slightly early. In the air, but away from Amir's outstretched left hand

back of a length outside off, angling away from Duminy and he's poking at it. The ball goes past his outside edge and both keeper and bowler go up for the appeal. The umpire isn't interested. They contemplate reviewing, but choose not to
width offered outside off, short ball and cut to point. Crunched, but to the man there
good length on middle stump, mistimes his front-foot drive to mid on. The fielder scampers across to his right to stop  this
good length just outside off. Tries to cut, but too close to his body. Slapped to point
good length wide outside off, punched off the front foot to the off side. To cover point on this occasion

overpitched on off stump, Duminy misses the flick to the leg side and hits his front leg. Big appeal and given! Plumb. The ball comes in with the angle and traps the left-hander in front of off stump. Hales wants Duminy to walk back
good length on leg stump, angling across Walton and defended off the back foot
full on off stump, Tries to punch towards cover, but inside edged to short fine leg. Close, could've easily chopped onto his stumps. Impressive over from Usman
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid off, but no place for a single
short outside leg stump, and Hales goes chasing at it. Tries to pull over short fine leg, but can't connect. Goes through to the keeper

overpitched on off stump, big stride forward and driven past cover! Excellent timing, and the ball races along the ground to the deep extra cover boundary. It was the slower ball too, and Hales picked the daylights out of it
muscled to the leg side on this occasion. Good length on leg stump, and pulled to the man in the deep
good length on leg stump, another slower ball and gets big on Hales too. Tries to tap it towards the leg side, but it's in the air! Drops short of mid on, however
another slower ball, back of a length on leg stump. Defended off the back foot to Amir
good length on middle stump, opens the bat's face and glances it to point on this occasion. Says 'no' to the single
good length outside off, but angling into Walton. Tries to flick to the leg side, but can't connect. The ball hits his front pad and goes to the off side
back of a length but too wide, stands tall and cuts over point to the boundary. Too easy for the tall batsman, gotta go shorter than that. Can't allow Hales to free his arms
taken next ball! Straight to the bowler, and he's quick to react. Good length outside off, and punched straight back to young Irfan. The ball got big on Hales and he did not adjust. Big wicket
full just outside off, steps forward and drives to cover
short outside off, and zipping into the batsman. Tries to play with the bat's open face, and it's cut fine! No one at third man, and Misbah earns a boundary
full just outside off, but angling in. Misbah walks across to the off side and taps it down to mid on. Sees the over off
full and wide outside off, forced to reach at it and driven to the man in the deep at extra cover
full on off and angling away, driven with the bat's open face. Straight to cover point
off the glove! But falls safe. Short on leg stump, and Misbah gets his bat in front of his face. Didn't keep his eyes on the ball and the delivery hits his left hand. Drops in no-man's land
short again! And off his glove once more. Pitches on leg stump but angling slightly across Misbah. Tries the defend but the ball gets big on him. Hits his glove and drops towards the leg side
full outside off, and tries an extravagant cover drive. Can't connect. Through to the keeper, nice carry
full on middle stump, Misbah stays on the back foot and fends it towards the non-striker
good length on leg stump, Walton opens his stance and defends back to the bowler. Played off the back foot
bad line, and punished by Walton. Good length, but outside leg, and flicked nonchalantly past short fine leg
full on middle stump, gets his front foot out of the way and slogged towards the leg side. Mistimed to the leg side

short on middle stump, defended off the back foot towards the on side. Walton wants the single, but Misbah says no. Meanwhile, Usman's run across to his left and tries to throw at the non-striker's end. Walton's dive saves him
vintage Misbah! Full on middle, and he brings his bottom hand into play. Lifted over Usman, and even though it's not hit well, it goes almost for a six. Falls just inside the long-on boundary
short on middle stump, stays low and pulled along the ground to midwicket
full on off stump, big stride forward and driven back to Afridi
good length outside off, turns into the batsman, and cut off the back foot to deep backward point. Work for Ingram at the deep, but he's quick
good length just outside off, goes straight through this time. Stands tall, and cuts to point
good length on off stump, this one angles right in with the drift. Hurries onto the batsman, and whipped towards the leg side
full on off stump, goes onto the back foot and cut to point. They want the single, and make it in time. The keeper took the bails off, but he was always in
good length just outside off, cut off the back foot, but once again to point
good length just outside off, Walton backs away to slog it towards the leg side, but can't connect. Goes past his outside edge and to the keeper
good length on off stump, flicked off his pads to midwicket
edged past the keeper! Good length on off, and tries to cut, but takes the top edge. The keeper dives to his right but just past him. Tried to play it fine, for sure, but not that fine!
good length on middle stump, tries to defend but takes a thick outside edge to third man
full on middle stump, tries to nudge it towards the leg side but doesn't come off the bat. They scamper across for the single nonetheless
length ball on middle stump, but Walton's had enough! Walks across to the off side and scoops this over short fine leg! That's the team fifty as well.
good length just outside off, shuffles to the leg side and tries to cut, but almost chops on! Ricochets off his pads to the off side
short on middle stump and angling into Misbah. Tries to work it towards the leg side by walking down the wicket, but can't connect. Off his pads and through to the off side

big appeal for lbw! But not given. Good length on middle stump and zipping straight through. Walton rocks back to try and pull, but the ball stays low. Hits his front pad, but would've gone down leg side
back of a length outside off, spinning inwards. Misbah shuffles to the leg side - showing all three stumps - and cuts. But only to point
good length on middle stump, and spins into Misbah. Foxed by the spin, as Misbah comes walking down the wicket. Can't connect with it once again

breaks the leg stump! Tossed up final ball, and Misbah goes down on one knee for the big slog. Can't hit the ball, and the delivery goes under his bat and onto the stumps. Enticed Misbah for the slog, and Afridi earns his wicket. Doesn't celebrate, perhaps as a sign of respect. And now Afridi's getting treatment on his lower back and left knee
full on off stump, bunts it down the ground to long on
good length on leg stump, forces Hussain to go to the back foot, and fended
into the stands! Islamabad need more of those. Full outside off, enough room to free his arms, and smacked over the bowler's head. Raw power on display, uff
good length just outside off, and angling into Walton. Defended off the back foot, past the non striker, to mid on
full outside off, and slashes hard at it. But the ball's too far away from him, forcing Hussain to reach at it, and it's been sliced. Taken in the deep. Played it too square than he intended to
full on middle stump, flicked off his pads to deep midwicket
touch short and spinning away, steered to deep cover

drifts in a quicker delivery from wide of the crease, he looks to give this a proper whack over long-on but misses it completely as the off stump is flattened. Afridi brings out his trademark celebration. Islamabad in all sorts of trouble. The umpires checked a number of times to confirm Afridi wasn't too far wide of the crease while delivering that.
squirts this quicker delivery to short third man. No chance of a single
right into the blockhole, he looks to hoick this away, ends up squeezing it to deep midwicket
quicker length ball on off stump, defended from the crease towards point
touch short outside off, he rocks back to make room and crash this behind point. This was asking to be hit and he put that away superbly
angles in a length ball on off from wide of the crease, defended with soft hands
dropped by the mid-off fielder running backwards. This was lofted but a complete miscue. Should've been taken nonetheless. Got his hands to it, did all the hard work running back but couldn't hold on
uses the pace of the bowler to run this down to third man
cramps him for room with a length ball angling in, defended
hammered straight back past the bowler's head. Length on the stumps and he swung clean to clear the ropes. Magnificent strike
back to back sixes. This is bigger than the previous one. Too full on the stumps, he uses the depth of the crease to swing this way over the long-on boundary. Deadly straight hit
squirts this full delivery wide of cover for an easy single
steers this short ball to backward point
driven with the spin to cover
fired full on the pads, worked towards the fielder coming in from deep midwicket. Excellent running, aggressive running. Poor fielding though
tucks this full delivery on middle and leg towards the leg side
on the shorter side, skids through though, steered to sweeper cover
carved away towards sweeper cover for a couple

this boy can bat or what. He's putting up quite a show of six-hitting. Short of length delivery angling away, he uses the hint of width to swing this cleanly back over the bowler's head. Long-off was in business but all too briefly.
this is another one. What hitting! This time, there's too much width outside off and he slaps this over deep cover. Just flew off the blade. Mills becoming a little too predictable
Mills comes from around the stumps and has his revenge this time. Floats in a length ball from wide of the crease, the ball keeps a touch low to sneak past the batsman's defense.
turns this incoming delivery towards fine leg
stands tall and punches towards backward point
angles in a length ball from wide of the crease, eased to square third man

has he miscued this? Oh, yes. He has. Looked to slap this over mid-off but couldn't get any timing behind that. As easy as catches go. Amir banged the ball in, this skidded on much faster than the batsman expected. The slide continues after a brief spurt. Amir pats Shadab as he runs over to celebrate with his mates.
angles in a full delivery, defended from the crease
pulls and misses. Played too early, this ball kept low
bunts this length ball gently towards point for a quick single
right behind the line of the balla as he bunts this towards midwicket
angles in a skiddy short of length ball on the stumps from around the wicket, defended
slashes and misses. Looked to stand tall and flay that away through point
dabs this gently towards the man coming in from deep point
struck on the pad, big appeal for lbw but this may have been sliding down. Or would it have? Very, very close. Replays suggest a part of the leg stump was visible. They scamper a legbye
leans forward and dabs this length ball towards backward point
stands tall and steers this length ball into the gap at deep point

Oh, dear oh dear. This has been put down at wide long-on by Babar Azam and how. Absolute sitter. He swung through this length ball but didn't time it as well as he would've liked. Straight in and straight out.
works this incoming length ball into the leg side for a quick single
clean bowled. 'You miss, I hit' policy. Angles in a length ball from wide of the crease, once again he looked to swing across the line, missed it completely and heard the rattle of timber.
beauty! Angles in and then straightens from off stump to beat the forward push.
squared up by the length. Beaten again. This was a nervous poke outside off
squirts this full length delivery towards extra cover
back-of-the-hand slower ball on middle, turned towards midwicket for a quick single
gets on top of the bounce and steers this down to square third man
width outside off, he slashes this and gets this down to the short third man region
slapped away over mid-off. Slower delivery landed at length, enough time for him to line up that shot. Waited, waited and then blasted that over the infield. Right off the middle
deflected to the third man region
nips back in from length outside off, defended.
angles a length ball on the pads, tucked towards midwicket. Looks for the second but is sent back
carved away towards sweeper cover, sliding stop at wide long-off by Morgan keeps it down to a couple

high in the air, so high that you could've had a cup of tea before settling underneath. Afridi called for it at point and completed the catch. He looked to pull from outside off and ended up slicing it high.
swings this high full toss down to long-on
length ball angling in from wide of the crease, hoicks this down to midwicket

as plumb as umpiring decisions come. Full, straight and honing in towards the stumps from around the wicket. this hits him flush on the toe and would've gone on to crash into the stumps. What a stunning bowling performance from Karachi Kings. Usman Shinwari has been magnificent all evening.The batsman reviewed for the heck of it, well knowing there was little chance of the decision being overturned. Karachi need 125 to win the match, 109 to qualify
good length on off stump, forced to go onto the backfoot and tapped to midwicket
full on middle stump, attempts to muscle it towards the leg side, but only to the man on the leg side
flat outside leg stump, tries to sweep but can't connect. Off the keeper's pad and trickling down to fine leg. Chase for the infielder
full outside leg stump after seeing the batsman make some room. Clipped off his toes to deep backward square
full on off stump, smacked down the ground to long off
back of a length on leg stump, tries to pull but can't get bat to ball. Off his thigh pad
full on leg stump, going down the leg side but brushes his pad. Tried to sweep again but, once again, fails to get bat on ball
short outside off, tries to cut, but the ball stays low. Bottom edged, and back to the bowler
back of a length on the fourth-stump line. Much better line this time. Goes onto the back foot, and fended to Amad
back of a length outside off, stands tall and creams this past cover point! Enough width for the birthday boy to free his arms
good length on middle stump, punched off the back foot to mid on
good length just outside off, slashes hard at it, and sends it over point. Goes all the way! Manzoor's a tall fella too, and that length is just waiting to be punished
full on middle stump, gets his front foot out of the way, and whips it over square leg! Gauged the length early and used his wrists to flick it onto the leg side
good length on middle, going down the leg side and Denly tries to turn it towards fine leg. Comes off his pad, though
good length on middle stump, it's going down leg but the batsman's already shuffled way past leg stump. Muscles it to deep midwicket
good length on middle and leg, zipping down the leg side and this time it's an extra
full on leg stump, down on one knee, and swept! Big stride forward from Denly, and it's gone over the ropes once again!
flat outside off, punched off the back foot to cover
good length just outside off, goes deep onto the back foot and punched to cover again. Good comeback from the young spinner
full on middle stump, tapped straight back to the bowler
full just outside off. Big wind up from the batsman, and flat-batted to mid on
good length just outside off, cut into the ground, and the ball lobs over point! Chase for third man, but he manages to cut it off
overpitched full just outside off stump. Bunted down the ground to mid on once again for a quick single
back of a length just outside off stump, rocks back and punches to cover point

given lbw! But he reviews. Good length on off stump, but Manzoor opens his stance to slog towards the leg side. Wild swing from Manzoor, but he misses, and it hits his back leg. Impact in front of middle, and the ball would've gone on break leg stump. There's the first wicket
good length on off stump, gets on top of the ball and smothers this to deep midwicket. He'll keep strike
full on off stump, tapped back to the bowler but he can't hold on to it. Goes between his legs to mid off, and they scamper across for the single

inside out over wide long off! Full just outside off, and Denly manages to get under this. Gets his back leg out of the way to get the full followthrough of the bat, and smacked just past Duminy in the deep. The fielder signals six, but the umpires want to have a look anyway. Haha, it's four! Thank God for umpires
good length on off stump, shuffles across to the off side and flicks to deep midwicket
full on middle stump, prods forward and nudges it to midwicket this time
overpitched on midlde and leg, clipped off his toes but straight to the man at short fine leg
full on middle stump, Denly dances down the wicket and muscles it towards the leg side. Comes off the bat's inside half on this occasion as he tried to play straight
full and straight on middle. Denly backs away and smacks it down the ground, but Finn gets a finger to it. Takes the pace off it as the ball goes to mid off
good length just outside off, and this time it's the slower ball! Tries to run it down fine, but can't make contact. The late cut does not come off

good length on leg stump, Denly makes room and swats this to the leg side. Work for the man in the deep, and the slide from the fielder there isn't good enough. His body's touching the mid-wicket boundary, so another boundary to Karachi's name. Two extra runs given away
full on off stump, gets onto the back foot and defended with soft hands
full on off stump, and it's been smacked past the bowler! Finn is quick to dive under this shot. Good, that he did so, because Denly hit that with some power. Races away to the long-off boundary
good length just outside off, backs away and tries to power this towards cover, but can't get bat on ball. One bounce and to the keeper
good length just outside off, cut off the back foot to deep backward point. They walk across for the run
tight on a good length just outside off, punched off the back foot, but straight to cover

good length just outside off, it's well punched off the back foot, and the ball's racing off the carpet. Two men in the deep there, but neither long off nor deep extra cover can cut that off. What a shot
it's the one that comes in on this occasion. Good length just outside off, and spins inwards. Tapped to cover point and Denly calls for the quick single
flighted, and full on off stump. Driven firmly past Shadab's left to long off
full on leg stump, Denly tries another sweep but misses. Hits the keeper's pads and goes down to short fine leg
full on off stump, driven to deep extra cover off the front foot. They walk across for the single
good length outside off stump, pushed off the back foot to cover for a comfortable run
good length on off stump, and angles into the batsman. Tapped to mid on off the back foot
creamed over cover! Good length outside off, and Denly makes room on the leg side. Flat-bats it thereafter, and the ball's raced away to the boundary
good length on middle and leg, Denly shuffles across to the off side and flicks it fine. Doesn't come off the bat, but he'll take it. Trickles down to the fine-leg boundary
Denly's done! Third time, lucky, Faheem. Good length on middle stump and he makes room once again to slap this over cover. The ball stays low, and zips under his bat. Takes the top of middle.
back of a length on leg stump, tapped off his hips to square leg for a quick run
full on off stump, driven down the ground to the bowler
full just on off stump, driven to mid off this time
tossed up on middle stump, driven firmly past Shadab's left to mid off
tossed up on middle and leg, the ball turns inwards and defended towards the off side

stays low! And almost bowled. Shadab can't believe how that hasn't hit the stumps. Full on middle, and it's the wrong'un. Turns away from Morgan as he tried to defend, but barely any bounce off the surface
finds the edge! Full on off stump, and Morgan prods forward. Tries to defend, but the ball takes a feather touch. Sharp take from the keeper!
full on off stump, tapped down the ground to long on for a walking single. Karachi happy to knock things around for ones and twos
good length on leg stump, stands tall and defends back to Faheem
good length on off stump, slashes hard at it and sends it down to deep point
good length just outside off, pokes at it, and sends it to point. No run, though
good length on leg stump, turned off his hips to deep midwicket
full on leg stump, gets down on one knee and runs this fine! Paddled past the keeper's right and it's running away to the boundary!
full on middle stump, turning away from the batsman. Driven to mid off
full on off stump, driven to mid off and there's a slight hesitation. They're taking the single, anyway, and done quite comfortably
works this into the leg side
saved by an inside edge. Stifled appeal as he got this to straighten from middle.
flatter on middle and leg, worked towards deep square leg
gets behind the line of this length ball as he bunts it into the off side
stands tall and punches this length delivery to Misbah at extra cover
hammered. Too short, Ingram right on top of the bounce as he swivelled back and pulled in front of square
solidly punched to Misbah at cover again
right behind the line as he bunts this delivery into the off side
floats this much fuller on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
square driven with the spin to sweeper cover
lunges forward and defends this tossed up delivery back to the bowler
on the pads, worked behind square to deep square leg
slow turn from length on off stump, eased to point
slider outside off, he lunges forward and defends to get a thick inside edge into the leg side
looks to work this into the legside but is beaten by the skid on this delivery, hit on the thigh pad.
too short, he rocks back and cuts to sweeper cover. They amble back for the second
right to the pitch of the ball as he eases this to long-off
got too close to the delivery as he tried to drive, squeezed back to the bowler
makes room and punches this into the gap at deep extra cover
slider that drifts back into middle, defended towards covers
dropped by Ashraf at long-on! Fairly straightforward. Ingram danced down the track and dragged this from way outside off as he looked to hit this out of the park. Not timed well enough
floated full on off, driven firmly to mid-off
touch full on off, he mistimes an attempted drive to cover
leans forward and punches this length ball to sweeper cover
punches this length ball to the cover fielder
right to the pitch of the ball as he eases this to long-off
top shot. Disdainfully done. Right in his swinging arc and he tees off in style to clear long-off
Angles in a length ball from wide of the crease, punched to midwicket
gets on top of the bounce and bunts this into the leg side
dabs this gently down to third man as they amble a single
Karachi have qualified! This is a stunning short-arm jab that sails over midwicket. Stupendous power off the bottomhand. Picked the length early.
flays this length ball outside off to sweeper cover
gets inside the line of this short delivery and helps this behind square. No chance for fine leg. Sublime timing
drifts in a full delivery on middle, punched down to long-on
rocks back and cuts, beats the diving point fielder. Down to the sweeper who comes around from the cover boundary.
right into the blockhole, squeezed back to Duminy
steps out and swings this shortish delivery to long-on
much slower to the air, nicely tossed up as a result, Ingram stretches forward and drives to deep cover

that's the end of that. Rocks back and hammers this pull to the midwicket boundary. A cruise in the end as Karachi seal their playoff berth in style. Babar has once again played a steady knock. Didn't need much more from him, really. Islamabad will go back and look away on what was a shoddy batting performance to say the least. Outplayed in every department tonight.
